content: The build is failing with the message "The code "I21.0" is not valid in the system http://hl7.org/fhir/sid/icd-10". The I21.0 code is used in an instance example and is a valid ICD-10 code for "Acute transmural myocardial infarction of anterior wall"

@AbdulMalik Shakir My first question is, is the build failing (i.e. not completing), or generating an error or other message? The other thing to say is that only a subset of the ICD-10 codes are currently supported (and it does matter which ICD "flavor" - e.g. ICD-10, ICD-10-CM, etc.). If you need to have this particular one or other specific codes supported by the build server, if you can provide a list we can get them added.
@Rob Hausam the build is not failing, an error is generated. It is not necessary that this particular code is used. This is just an instance example. The "flavor" of ICD is ICD-10.

@AbdulMalik Shakir I don't think it should be generating more than a warning message. Can you paste the output here? If you have a list of codes that you would like to have supported in the build server (this one and any others), let me know.
